description: Borrowed from Powhatan poughkone. Doublet of poke.

entries.meaning: (countable, botany) Any one of several plants yielding a red pigment which is used by the North American Indians, such as the bloodroot and two species of Lithospermum, Lithospermum hirtum and Lithospermum canescens.
(uncountable) The red pigment (dye) obtained from these plants.
examples: their head and shoulders [were] painted red, with Oyle and Pocones mingled together, which Scarlet-like colour made an exceeding handsome shew [...].
